subject: Climate & Environment
title: Cape Town's Day Zero
description: Learn Cape Town's Day Zero in one minute.

hook.text: In 2018, Cape Town nearly became the first major city to run out of water completely.

buildup.text: Three years of drought emptied reservoirs to 13% capacity. Rationing began at 50 liters per person.

discovery.text: Citizens lined up at springs. Farmers lost crops. The date reservoirs would hit zero was published.

twist.text: Day Zero never arrived. Strict rationing and emergency measures cut usage by 50% in months.

climax.text: But the underlying problem â€” over-reliance on rain-fed dams â€” remains for many cities.

punchline.text: Cape Town was a warning. The next city might not be so lucky.

quiz.question: What was 'Day Zero' in Cape Town?
options: The projected date taps would run dry
The first day of rain after the drought
